claim: Flublok is produced using a novel production platform in which recombinant HA is expressed in insect cells using a baculovirus expression vector system (BEVS).

verified_evidence.quote: The recombinant quadrivalent influenza vaccine (RIV4, Flublok®, Supemtek® [EU, Canada], Sanofi pasteur) was the first licensed influenza vaccine to be produced using recombinant viral proteins instead of antigens derived from live influenza virus (as for inactivated split virion and subunit vaccines). RIV4 is an unadjuvanted vaccine containing 45 µg of HA/dose from each of the four strains. The production of RIV4 is based on a novel production platform in which recombinant HA (rHA) is expressed in insect cells using a baculovirus expression vector system (BEVS)22. In brief, expresSF+ insect cells are infected with recombinant baculovirus carrying the relevant influenza HA genes, which are expressed under the control of a baculovirus polyhedrin promoter.
verified_evidence.explanation: The quote appears in the document on page 2, starting with: 'The recombinant quadrivalent influenza vaccine (RIV4, Flublok®, Supemtek® [EU, Canada], Sanofi pasteur) was the first licensed influenza vaccine to be produced using recombinant viral proteins instead of antigens derived from live influenza virus (as for inactivated split virion and subunit vaccines). RIV4 is an unadjuvanted vaccine containing 45 µg of HA/dose from each of the four strains. The production of RIV4 is based on a novel production platform in which recombinant HA (rHA) is expressed in insect cells using a baculovirus expression vector system (BEVS)22. In brief, expresSF+ insect cells are infected with recombinant baculovirus carrying the relevant influenza HA genes, which are expressed under the control of a baculovirus polyhedrin promoter.' The factual content, technical details, and structure of the quote are preserved, with only minor formatting and spacing differences.. The quote directly and explicitly states that Flublok (RIV4) is produced using a novel production platform in which recombinant HA is expressed in insect cells using a baculovirus expression vector system (BEVS). This matches the claim exactly, providing both the method (recombinant HA in insect cells) and the technology (baculovirus expression vector system), and even names the vaccine (Flublok). No inference is required; the quote fully and unambiguously supports the claim.

verified_evidence.quote: RECOMBINANT HA EXPRESSION SYSTEMS Both prokaryotic and eukaryotic expression systems have been used for the manufacture of rHA vaccine antigens. ... Several groups have explored the use of adeno virus (AdV), primarily as a replication defective vector, for gene delivery and trans gene expression of rHA in the host cells. ... by integrating HA, cap sid protein (M1) and neuraminidase (NA) expressed in insect cells 44 46. Although presenting proteins in VLP structures enhanced their immunogen i city, it compromised the purity of the vaccines considerably, as VLP structures also integrated both baculo virus and Sf9 cell proteins. ... Insect cell derived rHA (RIV4) has been studied extensively by various groups in both pre clinical models and humans.
verified_evidence.explanation: The quote appears on page 3 of the document, though with some minor differences in formatting and wording due to OCR correction. The content is semantically equivalent: it discusses both prokaryotic and eukaryotic expression systems for rHA, mentions the use of adenovirus vectors, and specifically describes the integration of HA, capsid protein (M1), and neuraminidase (NA) expressed in insect cells. It also notes that VLP structures produced in insect cells can include baculovirus and Sf9 cell proteins, and concludes with the statement that 'Insect cell derived rHA (RIV4) has been studied extensively by various groups in both pre clinical models and humans.' All key technical facts and context from the quote are present in the document.. The quote directly supports the claim. It explicitly states that recombinant HA (rHA) can be expressed in insect cells, and that RIV4 (Flublok) is an example of an insect cell-derived rHA vaccine. It also references the use of a baculovirus expression vector system (BEVS) for this purpose, as described elsewhere in the document. The quote distinguishes this method from other recombinant expression systems and provides specific details about the use of insect cells and baculovirus, which substantiates the claim that Flublok is produced using a novel platform where recombinant HA is expressed in insect cells using BEVS.

rejected_evidence.quote: Insect cell derived rHA (RIV4) has been studied extensively by various groups in both pre clinical models and humans. The rHA contained in RIV4 differs from that expressed in other systems in terms of specific structural features, the nature of the source material and the manufacturing process, which have an impact on certain aspects of vaccine safety and efficacy (Fig. 2).
rejected_evidence.original_explanation: This quote affirms that RIV4 (Flublok) uses recombinant HA derived from insect cells, highlighting the unique manufacturing process relevant to the claim.
